intro: Dehaasia elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, lance-shaped leaves and bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Dehaasia elliptica is also noted for its ability to withstand cold temperatures and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
